tool.name: BEAST2
tool.command:
## Copy input XML file cp '$input_xml' beast_input.xml &&
## Run BEAST2 beast -threads \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} -overwrite beast_input.xml &&
## Copy outputs to Galaxy expected locations cp beast_input.log '$log_output' && cp beast_input.trees '$trees_output'

param.name: input_xml
param.label: BEAST XML configuration file
param.help: Pre-configured BEAST2 XML file containing analysis settings

param.name: chain_length
param.label: Override MCMC chain length (optional)
param.help: If specified, will override the chain length in the XML file

data.name: log_output
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Parameter log
data.help: MCMC parameter samples and log-likelihood values

data.name: trees_output
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Tree samples
data.help: MCMC tree samples in Newick format

tool.help:
**What it does**
BEAST2 is a cross-platform program for Bayesian phylogenetic analysis of molecular sequences. It estimates rooted, time-measured phylogenies using strict or relaxed molecular clock models.
**Input**
A BEAST2 XML configuration file containing: - Sequence alignment data - Analysis parameters (substitution model, clock model, tree prior) - MCMC settings (chain length, sampling frequency)
You can create XML files using BEAUti (BEAST2's GUI application) or other tools.
**Output**
- **Parameter log**: Tab-delimited file with MCMC parameter samples and log-likelihood values - **Tree samples**: Collection of phylogenetic trees sampled during the MCMC analysis
**Usage Tips**
- For test runs, use shorter chain lengths (10,000 - 100,000 steps) - For production analyses, use longer chains (10,000,000+ steps) - Check parameter log file for convergence diagnostics - Use multiple independent runs and combine results for robust inference
